entry.title: About
entry.summary: Hello, my name is Emily Yap and this is a new blog I've created! A little about me, I m studying Ecology and Zoology and I am currently working on my Masters project on the Little penguin in Aotearoa New Zealand. I grew up in…
entry.content:
Hello, my name is Emily Yap and this is a new blog I've created! A little about me, I m studying Ecology and Zoology and I am currently working on my Masters project on the Little penguin in Aotearoa New Zealand. I grew up in Malaysia, the country of really good food and I love spending my time outside, painting with watercolour and eating fried chicken. 

I started this blog with the intention to have a platform where I can share a bit of my research and my studies, but also to talk about different topics relating on conservation and the environment. The earth and the people on it are pretty important to me, and so I hope to share some of my thoughts and discoveries with you while I journey. 

"In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. 2 He was with God in the beginning. 3 Through him all things were made; without him nothing was made that has been made. 4 In him was life, and that life was the light of all mankind. 5 The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it."

entry.title: Introduction to Narwhals
entry.summary: Narwhals or Narwhales are one of the two species from the family Monodontidae, (Monodon monoceros). These whales are unique -left helical - Greek meaning, “one-tooth one-horn.” -travels -status
entry.content:
Narwhals or Narwhales are one of the two species from the family Monodontidae, (Monodon monoceros). These whales are unique
